  • Constructor Details

    • Attestation

      public Attestation​(@NotNull @NotNull StorageElementIdentifier identifier, @NotNull @NotNull IssuerPartAttestation firstLayer, @NotNull @NotNull RevocationCommitment revocationCommitmentReceiver, @NotNull @NotNull StorageElementIdentifier storageElementIdentifierNextQueueElement, @NotNull @NotNull PrivateEntityIdentifier privateEntityIdentifierReceiver) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Constructor for the Attestation class.
      Parameters:
      identifier - The StorageElementIdentifier which will be used / is used to store this Attestation with in the StorageLayer of the framework.
      firstLayer - The issuer's generated part of the Attestation.
      revocationCommitmentReceiver - The RevocationCommitment of the receiver of the Attestation.
      storageElementIdentifierNextQueueElement - The StorageElementIdentifier for the next element in the receiver's personal queue.
      privateEntityIdentifierReceiver - The PrivateEntityIdentifier of the receiver of the Attestation.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encryption keys are invalid.

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid​(@NotNull @NotNull PrivateEntityIdentifier privateEntityIdentifierReceiver, @NotNull @NotNull PublicEntityIdentifier publicEntityIdentifierReceiver, @NotNull @NotNull PublicEntityIdentifier publicEntityIdentifierIssuer, @NotNull @NotNull RTreePolicy policy) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Method to check the validity of the Attestation.
      Parameters:
      privateEntityIdentifierReceiver - The PrivateEntityIdentifier of the user receiving the Attestation.
      publicEntityIdentifierReceiver - The PublicEntityIdentifier of the user receiving the Attestation.
      publicEntityIdentifierIssuer - The PublicEntityIdentifier of the user issuing the Attestation.
      policy - The RTreePolicy for the Attestation.
      Returns:
      True if the Attestation is valid; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the validity can't be checked with the provided encryption keys.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid​(@NotNull @NotNull java.security.PrivateKey empiricalPrivateRSAKey, @NotNull @NotNull java.security.PublicKey empiricalPublicRSAKey, @NotNull @NotNull PublicEntityIdentifier publicEntityIdentifierReceiver) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Method to check the validity of the Attestation.
      Parameters:
      empiricalPrivateRSAKey - The empirical RSA PrivateKey of the Attestation.
      empiricalPublicRSAKey - The empirical RSA PublicKey of the Attestation.
      publicEntityIdentifierReceiver - The PublicEntityIdentifier of the user receiving the Attestation.
      Returns:
      True if the Attestation is valid; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the validity can't be checked with the provided encryption keys.

    • validateAndReturnPolicy

      @NotNull public @NotNull RTreePolicy validateAndReturnPolicy​(@NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String firstAESKey) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Method to return the RTreePolicy of this Attestation, if the Attestation is valid.
      Parameters:
      firstAESKey - The AES key to decrypt the VerificationInformationSegmentAttestation with.
      Returns:
      The RTreePolicy of this Attestation.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided AES key is incorrect, or if this Attestation is invalid.

    • isRevoked

      public boolean isRevoked​(@NotNull @NotNull StorageLayer storageLayer) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Method to check if this Attestation is revoked.
      Parameters:
      storageLayer - The StorageLayer to consult.
      Returns:
      True if this Attestation is revoked; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the StorageLayer could not be consulted, due to an IO-related problem.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Attestation is invalid; that is, the PublicEntityIdentifier specified in the first layer for the receiver could not be used to decrypt the content of the second layer, which contains the second RevocationCommitment.

    • areSecondAndThirdLayerValid

      public boolean areSecondAndThirdLayerValid​(@NotNull @NotNull PublicEntityIdentifier publicEntityIdentifierReceiver) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Method to check if the second and third layers of the Attestation instance are valid.
      Parameters:
      publicEntityIdentifierReceiver - the PublicEntityIdentifier of the user receiving the Attestation.
      Returns:
      True if the layers are valid; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the validity of the layers can't be checked with the provided argument.
